TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy-skeletal, mixed, superactive, frigid Lithic Haplustalfs

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Tolex channery loam, forest (colors are for dry soil unless otherwise noted).
0--1 inch to 0; forest litter of partially decomposed needles, twigs and roots; clear smooth boundary. (1/2 to 2 inches thick)
A--0 to 1 inch; grayish brown (10YR 5/2) channery loam, very dark grayish brown (10YR 3/2) moist; moderate very thin platy structure parting to moderate very fine granular; soft, very friable, slightly sticky and nonplastic; common fine and very fine roots; many very fine interstitial pores; 20 percent channers; moderately acid (pH 5.6); clear smooth boundary. (0 to 2 inches thick)
E--1 to 5 inches; very pale brown (10YR 7/3) channery loam, yellowish brown (10YR 5/4) moist; moderate very thin platy structure; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common fine and very fine and few medium roots; many very fine interstitial pores; gray silt and sand skeletans on faces of plates; 20 percent channers; moderately acid (pH 5.8); clear smooth boundary. (2 to 5 inches thick)
Bt--5 to 13 inches; light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) extremely channery clay loam, yellowish brown (10YR 5/4) moist; moderate medium and fine subangular blocky structure; hard, friable, sticky and slightly plastic; common fine and very fine and few medium roots; many very fine tubular and interstitial pores; continuous distinct clay films on faces of peds and on coarse fragments; 65 percent channers; slightly acid (pH 6.2); gradual smooth boundary. (6 to 15 inches thick)
BC--13 to 18 inches; brownish yellow (10YR 6/6) extremely channery loam, yellowish brown (10YR 5/6) moist; weak very fine granular structure; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common fine and very fine roots; 85 percent channers, 5 percent flagstones; slightly effervescent on undersides of coarse fragments; neutral (pH 6.8) gradual wavy boundary. (0 to 6 inches thick)
R--18 inches; hard argillite bedrock with a few cracks; few fine roots in some cracks.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Lewis and Clark County, Montana; 2,100 feet south and 200 feet east of the NW corner of sec. 34, T. l2 N., R. 3 W.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Soil temperature - 40 to 47 degrees F.
Moisture control section - between 4 and 12 inches.
Depth to bedrock - 10 to 20 inches.
A horizon - Hue:  5YR, 7.5YR, or 10YR
Value:  5 or 6 dry; 3 or 4 moist
Chroma:  2 or 3
Texture:  loam or sandy loam
Clay content:  15 to 25 percent
Rock fragments:  15 to 75 percent--0 to 20 percent flagstones and stones, 15 to 55 percent channers
Reaction:  pH 5.6 to 7.3
E horizon - Hue:  5YR, 7.5YR, or 10YR
Value:  5, 6 or 7 dry; 4 or 5 moist
Chroma:  2, 3, or 4
Texture:  loam, sandy loam or coarse sandy loam
Clay content:  10 to 25 percent
Rock fragments:  15 to 75 percent--0 to 15 percent flagstones, 15 to 60 percent channers
Reaction:  pH 5.1 to 7.3
Bt horizon -  Hue:  5YR, 7.5YR, or 10YR
Value:  5 or 6 dry; 4 or 5 moist
Chroma:  3, 4, or 6
Texture:  clay loam, sandy clay loam or sandy loam
Clay content:  18 to 35 percent
Rock fragments:  60 to 80 percent--0 to 15 percent flagstones, 40 to 70 percent channers
Reaction:  pH 5.1 to 7.8
BC horizon - Hue:  5YR, 7.5YR, or 10YR
Value:  6 or 7 dry; 4 or 5 moist
Chroma:  3, 4, or 6
Clay content:  10 to 25 percent
Rock fragments:  60 to 90 percent - 0 to 10 percent flagstones, 55 to 85 percent channers
Reaction:  pH 5.1 to 7.8

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES:
Brickner (MT) - does not have E horizons; does not have more than 60 percent rock fragments in the argillic horizon.
Sanchez (NM) - has A&B horizons; less than 60 percent rock fragments in the control section.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Landform - bedrock-floored hills, mountains.
Slope - 8 to 80 percent.
Elevation - 3,500 to 6,200 feet. (Colorado has elevations of 7,500 to 9,000 feet)
Parent material - material derived from igneous argillite, sandstone, and metasedimentary rock.
Climate - long, cold winters; moist springs and early part of summer; warm summers.
Mean annual precipitation - 12 to 25 inches, most of which falls during the spring and early part of summer.
Mean annual air temperature - 38 to 45 degrees F.
Frost-free period - 70 to 120 days. (Colorado has a frost-free period of 75 to 140 days.)

USE AND VEGETATION.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; moderate or moderately slow permeability.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Tolex soils are used for range and woodland.  The native vegetation is mainly ponderosa pine, Douglas fir, bluebunch wheatgrass, Idaho fescue, rough fescue, arrowleaf balsamroots, forbs, and shrubs.

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Southwestern Montana and south-central Colorado.  Tolex soils are moderately extensive.

ORIGIN.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
ORIGIN.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE:  Bozeman, Montana

REMARKS.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Fremont County, Colorado, 1988; proposed in Lewis and Clark County, Montana, 1979.
